Text:
I'm not sure why...but she seemed down. I'm a little
worried about her.

*huff, huff* I need to become stronger before the
next sparring session...

(Only the strong are worthy to stand beside Master
Shadow. I can't allow myself to be content with my
current state...)
The weak...have no place at his side...!
Looks like you're working hard at your training.

In fact...I'd say you're using it as an outlet for
your emotions.
*gasp* Lady Beta!

It's important to sometimes let your body rest.
You seem to be pushing yourself too hard.

...I'll take that to heart. Was there something you
needed from me?
Will you really? Well, anyway, I'll get to the point.

I have a mission for you, and you're to undertake it
alone.

...I thought it was standard protocol for Shadow
Garden members to work in teams of three.

Of course, I know that. It's designed to balance out
any individual deficiencies in battle power.
You've fought with No. 89 before, haven't you?

Yes. If I recall correctly, she wasn't a
particularly challenging opponent.

The numbers assigned to members in the Garden
refer strictly to the order in which they joined.
They aren't a ranking system.

That said, each set of 100 tends to be a good deal
stronger than the next, so the numbers end up being
a decent measure anyway.

The earlier one joins the Garden, the more experience
they can accumulate from missions and training...

So, it's inevitable there would be a gap in skill
between the early members and the newcomers...
And that gap isn't easily closed...

Exactly. And yet, you managed to defeat her
decisively. That's why I believe you can handle
this mission on your own.

...If that's your reasoning, then I accept. Could
you please tell me more about the mission?

It's an investigation of one of the Cult's bases.
I've heard it's only a medium-sized base, so you
shouldn't have any trouble handling it alone.

Should you deem it feasible, you may single-handedly
annihilate them.
Understood. I'll make certain the job is completed.

Also, Epsilon seemed concerned about this as well...
but you sometimes push yourself too hard.

I've given you permission to single-handedly
annihilate them. But if you feel you are in danger,
retreat immediately. Do you understand?
...I do.
Do you really...?
What the...

A few days later, Victoria heads out on her mission
and comes upon the base, which is shrouded in
silence, corpses of the Cult members strewn about.
...A massacre. Someone got here before me.

(Each one was taken out with a single strike.
The assailant must be highly skilled...)

(There's only food, weapons, and documents related
to the Cult left in the cargo... So, was money the
motive?)

(If that's the case, it's unlikely that the
perpetrator was an enemy of the Cult. Could it
be...thieves? But it's difficult to imagine thieves
overpowering the Cult members.)

(Perhaps there was a group of them... No, there's
too little sign of struggle.)

...It's pointless to speculate. What I should be
concerned about now is

(The bodies are still warm. The attacker is likely
still nearby...!)

(I should probably return and report to Lady Beta...
but that would give the assailant a chance to
escape.)

If they intend to hinder Master Shadow's path...no
matter how skilled the assailant is, they must be
eliminated.

...Please watch me, Master Shadow. I will allow none
who stand in your way to escape...

I can't believe I've come this far without catching
a glimpse of anyone...

(The area around the base is infested with monsters,
making it unsuitable for hiding. Given the location,
the attacker is likely headed for the town.)

(The forest is getting denser...but this is the
shortest path)
Eeeeeek!!!
What the...

(A Cult member... Could it be a survivor? They might
have intel on the attacker...)
Hey.

Eeek...?! A-Are you the one...wh-wh-who massacred
our base...?!
...Wrong question.
W-Wait! I don't know anything!

When I returned from my mission, e-everyone was
dead... Right, intel! You want intel, don't you?! If
you let me go, I'll tell you whatever you want to
knowEeeek?!

Don't waste your breath. Intel from a low-level
member like you is practically worthless.

For starters, do you think I can trust the word of a
Cult member?

I didn't join the Cult out of choice...! To be
honest, I'm sick of this organization...

I wouldn't mind bowing to this "Shadow" of yours
if that's what it takes! So, please, just spare my
life...!
...Heheh. Is that so?
Y-Yes! So, I'm
Aaaaaaghh!!!

...Fool. How dare you flippantly utter Master Shadow's
name.

No. 559 mutters this as she gazes down at the blood
splattered in the moonlight and the several coins
flung into the air.

(An amount of gold exceeding his station... Another
ordinary fool who sold his soul to the Cult for
money, not realizing he was being used by them.)
*gasp*

Something cold touches the skin of No. 559's neck.
Someone has silently pressed a blade against her
from behind.

(Impossible! I sensed no one's presencenot even for
a moment!)
(Is this who attacked the base?)

(...If I turn around, I face death. But if I wait,
the outcome will be the same.)
(I might as well strike with my sword as I turn)
...Who the hell are you?
...Huh?
